newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt tries 10 for smuggling weapons from Sudan.
newsitem.headline: Egypt tries 10 for smuggling weapons from Sudan.

text.p: Eight Egyptians and two Sudanese went on trial in a military court in the southern city of Assiut on Saturday on charges of smuggling weapons and ammunition from Sudan, security sources said.
They said five of the men, including the two Sudanese, are being tried in absentia. The army says the men had planned to sell the arms in Egypt.
The sources said the men smuggled 46 Kalashkinov rifles and more than five thousands rounds across the border earlier this year.
Armed forces border guards seized the cache in August in Qena province, further south.
The sources said the men were weapons smugglers and not members of Moslem militant groups that are waging a low-level guerrilla war against Egyptian authorities in southern Egypt.
The men are being tried in a military court because they were arrested by the military's border guards.
Military courts have over the past few years been used to try civilians who were charged with belonging to militant groups trying to overthrow the Egyptian government.
